partOfSpeech: verblinking verblinking verblinking verblinking verblinking verblinking verblinking verblinking verb

definitions.definition: used when you are naming people or things, describing them or giving more information about them
definitions.sensetop: + noun+ adj.be (that)…be doing somethingbe to do something

examples.text: Today is Monday.
‘Who is that?’ ‘It's my brother.’
She's a great artist.
Susan is a doctor.
He wants to be *(= become)* a pilot when he grows up.
It's beautiful!
Life is unfair.
He is ten years old.
‘How are you?’ ‘I'm very well, thanks.’
Be quick!
**The fact is** (that) we don’t have enough money.
The problem is getting it all done in the time available.
The problem is to get it all done in the time available.

definitions.definition: used when you are describing a situation or saying what you think about it

examples.text: It was really hot in the sauna.
It's strange how she never comes to see us any more.
He thinks it's clever to make fun of people.
It would be a shame if you lost it.
It's going to be a great match.

definitions.definition: to exist; to be present

examples.text: Is there a God?
Once upon a time there was a princess…
I tried phoning but there was no answer.
There's a bank down the road.
Was there a pool at the hotel?

definitions.definition: to be located; to be in a place

examples.text: The town is three miles away.
If you're looking for your file, it's on the table.
Mary's upstairs.

definitions.definition: used to say where somebody was born or where their home is

examples.text: She's from Italy.

definitions.definition: to happen at a time or in a place

examples.text: The party is on Friday evening.
The meetings are always in the main conference room.

definitions.definition: to remain in a place

examples.text: She has been in her room for hours.
They're here till Christmas.

definitions.definition: to attend an event; to be present in a place

examples.text: I'll be at the party.
He'll be here soon *(= will arrive soon)*.

definitions.definition: used to talk about time

examples.text: It's two thirty.
It was late at night when we finally arrived.

definitions.definition: to cost

examples.text: ‘How much is that dress?’ ‘Eighty dollars.’

definitions.definition: to be equal to

examples.text: Three and three is six.
How much is a thousand pounds in euros?
Let x be the sum of a and b.
London is not England *(= do not think that all of England is like London)*.

definitions.definition: to visit or call

examples.text: I've never been to Spain.
He had been abroad many times.
Has the postman been yet?

definitions.definition: used to say what something is made of

examples.text: Is your jacket real leather?

definitions.definition: used to say who something belongs to or who it is intended for
definitions.sensetop: be mine, yours, etc.be for me, you, etc.

examples.text: The money's not yours, it's John's.
This package is for you.

definitions.definition: used to say how important something is to somebody

examples.text: Money isn't everything *(= it is not the only important thing)*.
A thousand dollars is nothing to somebody as rich as he is.

definitions.definition: as somebody/something used to be called

examples.text: Jill Davis that was *(= before her marriage)*
the Soviet Union, as was

definitions.definition: the most important part; all that matters

examples.text: Her career is the be-all and end-all of her existence.

definitions.definition: used to show that you are surprised and annoyed by something that somebody has done

examples.text: Someone's been and parked in front of the entrance!

definitions.definition: used to say that somebody/something stopped somebody/something from happening

examples.text: If it weren't for you, I wouldn't be alive today.

definitions.definition: used to show that you accept that something negative cannot be changed

examples.text: I never imagined that our company share prices would fall so low, but it is what it is.

definitions.definition: to leave somebody/something alone without bothering them/it

examples.text: Leave her be, she obviously doesn't want to talk about it.
Let the poor dog be *(= don't annoy it)*.

definitions.definition: future

examples.text: his bride-to-be
mothers-to-be *(= pregnant women)*

wordOrigin: Old English bēon, an irregular and defective verb, whose full conjugation derives from several originally distinct verbs. The forms am and is are from an Indo-European root shared by Latin sum and est. The forms was and were are from an Indo-European root meaning ‘remain’. The forms be and been are from an Indo-European root shared by Latin fui ‘I was’, fio ‘I become’, and Greek phuein ‘bring forth, cause to grow’. The origin of are is uncertain.
